sceneName: 课堂讨论：远程工作的影响

subScenes.name: 开场寒暄
subScenes.description: 教授开场引导讨论，学生礼貌回应

qaPairs.speakerText: Alright everyone, let's kick off today's discussion on remote work's impact on team cohesion. What's your take?
qaPairs.speakerTextCn: 好了同学们，我们开始今天关于远程工作对团队凝聚力影响的讨论，你们怎么看？

responses.text: I'd say it's mixed—some teams thrive, others fall apart without face-to-face time.
responses.text_cn: 我觉得是两极分化，有些团队反而更好，有些却因缺乏面对面交流而涣散。

responses.text: That’s a great question. I’ve read a Harvard study showing remote work reduces spontaneous collaboration.
responses.text_cn: 这是个好问题，我读过哈佛的一项研究，说远程工作减少了非正式协作。

qaPairs.usageNote: 用个人观察+权威研究结合回应，显深度

subScenes.name: 观点交锋
subScenes.description: 学生就跨文化沟通效率展开辩论

qaPairs.speakerText: I get that remote work helps with diversity, but don’t you think time zones make communication way harder?
qaPairs.speakerTextCn: 我明白远程工作有助于多元，但你不觉得时差让沟通难得多吗？

responses.text: Totally agree—I’ve seen teams waste hours waiting for replies across continents.
responses.text_cn: 完全同意，我见过团队因时差浪费数小时等回复。

responses.text: Actually, async tools like Loom and Notion solve that—culture matters more than time.
responses.text_cn: 其实异步工具如Loom和Notion能解决，文化理解比时间更重要。

qaPairs.usageNote: 用具体工具举例，增强说服力

qaPairs.speakerText: But if you’re not physically present, how do you build trust across cultures?
qaPairs.speakerTextCn: 但如果不在现场，你怎么在跨文化团队中建立信任？

responses.text: Regular virtual coffee chats and shared storytelling rituals help—MIT found that boosts psychological safety.
responses.text_cn: 定期线上咖啡聊天和故事分享能提升信任，MIT研究证实这增强心理安全感。

responses.text: You just need to be more intentional—send personal updates, ask about families.
responses.text_cn: 你得更主动点，分享个人近况，问问对方家人。

responses.text: I guess you just have to try.

qaPairs.usageNote: 引用研究或具体行为，避免空泛回答

subScenes.name: 未来技能
subScenes.description: 探讨远程工作对职场核心能力的影响

qaPairs.speakerText: I think digital literacy’s becoming the new baseline—like managing Slack, Zoom, and AI tools.
qaPairs.speakerTextCn: 我觉得数字素养正成为新底线，比如管理Slack、Zoom和AI工具。

responses.text: Exactly! And emotional intelligence matters even more—you can’t read body language remotely.
responses.text_cn: 没错！情绪智力更重要了，远程时你看不到肢体语言。

responses.text: I’d argue self-discipline is the real key—no one’s watching you at home.
responses.text_cn: 我认为自律才是关键，没人在家盯着你。

qaPairs.usageNote: 对比两种能力，突出深层逻辑

subScenes.name: 总结共识
subScenes.description: 学生归纳讨论要点，达成初步共识

qaPairs.speakerText: So, to wrap up—remote work demands better tech skills and cultural awareness, but it’s not killing teamwork, right?
qaPairs.speakerTextCn: 总结一下——远程工作要求更好的技术能力和文化意识，但没毁掉团队合作，对吧？

responses.text: Yeah, it’s reshaping it—not replacing it. The key is intentional design.
responses.text_cn: 对，是在重塑而非取代，关键是主动设计。

responses.text: Couldn’t agree more. If companies invest in virtual rituals, remote teams outperform office ones.
responses.text_cn: 完全同意，公司若投入虚拟仪式，远程团队表现更优。

qaPairs.usageNote: 用‘reshaping’等精准词替代笼统说法

subScenes.name: 礼貌结束
subScenes.description: 讨论结束，学生致谢并告别

qaPairs.speakerText: Thanks, everyone—this was way more insightful than I expected.
qaPairs.speakerTextCn: 谢谢大家，这次讨论比我预期深刻多了。

responses.text: Same here! Let’s keep this convo going on the Discord group.
responses.text_cn: 我也是！咱们去Discord群继续聊。

responses.text: Appreciate the depth of your perspectives. I’ll cite your points in my paper.
responses.text_cn: 感谢你们深刻的见解，我会在论文中引用。

qaPairs.usageNote: 用具体行动（如引用、群聊）体现真诚致谢
